Class CardPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • project.lima.CardPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class CardPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Class used to represent individual cards in the GUI.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CardPanel()
      Constructs a new, empty CardPanel for the GUI with a purple background color.
      CardPanel(Card card)
      Constructs a new CardPanel to display a given Card on the GUI and initializes its attributes to correspond to the given Card.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Card getCard()
      Observer method to retrieve the Card currently represented by this CardPanel.
      java.lang.String getCardName()
      Observer for getting the name of the Card represented by this CardPanel.
      java.lang.String getDescription()
      Observer for getting the description of the Card represented by this CardPanel.
      void getNewCard(Card card)
      Method to set the given card as the Card represented by this CardPanel and to reset all attributes of the CardPanel accordingly.
      RegCard getRegCard()
      Observer method to retrieve the Card currently represented by this CardPanel after casting it to a RegCard.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Observer method to determine whether the CardPanel is empty.
      void removeCardFromPanel()
      Method to reset the CardPanel to be empty, with no displayed Card.
      void setAttack()
      Method to reset this CardPanel's attackLbl attribute to match the attack of the Card it represents.
      void setHealth()
      Method to reset this CardPanel's healthLbl attribute to match the health of the Card it represents.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Observer method to determine whether the CardPanel is empty.
        Returns:
        false if the CardPanel has been assigned a card to represent, true otherwise
